roles.name: Board Director / Non-Executive Director
roles.description: Responsible for strategic oversight, approval of materiality criteria and MCI, quarterly review of control effectiveness, and final declaration approval.
keyResponsibilities: Approve materiality criteria and Material Control Inventory (Q1 2025)
Ensure adequate resources allocated to P29 implementation
criticalQuestions: How confident are we in the materiality thresholds we've set?
Do control owners truly understand their accountability?
What's our Plan B if controls are found ineffective?
Are we getting independent assurance, or just management attestation?
How does our approach compare to peers in our sector?

timeline.activity: Board workshop (2 hours): P29 overview, materiality criteria discussion, approval of MCI
Quarterly dashboard review (30 mins per Audit Committee, brief to full Board)
Dry run results review (1 hour Audit Committee deep-dive)

trainingResources.title: Provision 29 for Non-Executives
trainingResources.description: Overview of P29 requirements, board accountability, and key decision points

trainingResources.title: How to Challenge Management on Material Controls
trainingResources.description: Effective questions to ask and red flags to watch for

successMetrics: Board members can articulate the organisation's material controls and why they are material
Board demonstrates active engagement (not passive sign-off)
Board challenges management assumptions and assurance quality

roles.name: Chief Financial Officer (CFO)
roles.description: Executive sponsor of P29 programme, responsible for resource allocation, budget approval, and ultimate accountability for declaration.
keyResponsibilities: Ensure coordination with SOX, ECCTA, other compliance programmes

criticalDecisions.guidance: Typical: ¬£X million (absolute), Y% of profit (relative), regulatory penalty exposure
Budget: ¬£50,000-¬£500,000 depending on company size and platform selection

timeline.activity: Secure board mandate; approve project initiation
Approve MCI and materiality criteria at board
Review dry run results; assess readiness for FY2026
Approve board declaration for annual report

riskFlags.impact: Incomplete framework; inability to declare effectiveness
riskFlags.mitigation: Secure ¬£350k-¬£750k minimum for FTSE 250; scale for complexity
Ensure signed ownership acknowledgements; hold 1st line accountable
Start Phase 1 by Q1 2025; communicate urgency to board

roles.name: Chief Risk Officer / Head of Risk
roles.description: Programme lead and day-to-day owner of P29 implementation. Coordinates cross-functional team, builds MCI, manages GRC platform, and prepares board reports.
keyResponsibilities: Build and maintain Material Control Inventory
Own relationship with Internal Audit and external auditors

phase1: Establish steering committee with cross-functional members
Facilitate materiality workshops with Finance, Legal, Compliance, Operations
Map principal risks to existing controls (top-down approach)
Apply materiality criteria to create MCI (25-100 controls)
Conduct gap assessment (missing controls, immature controls)
Develop resource and budget plan for Phases 2-4
Present MCI to board for approval
Document steering committee governance and meeting cadence
Establish communication plan for all stakeholders
phase2: Formalise control definitions using standardised template
Assign named control owners (individuals, not departments)
Define effectiveness criteria for each control (measurable, quantified)
Implement remediation plans for identified gaps
Develop testing protocols by control type
Document evidence requirements for each control
Conduct control owner workshops (1st line training)
Update control library in GRC platform
Present control framework to Audit Committee
phase3: Create RACI matrix (3 lines of defence)
Oversee GRC platform implementation and go-live
Develop board dashboard ('Approach on a Page')
Plan and execute dry run (6-8 weeks)
Collect dry run evidence and testing results
Generate draft board dashboard with dry run data
Present dry run results to board
Document lessons learned and improvement actions
Confirm Phase 4 readiness with steering committee
phase4: Generate quarterly board dashboards (Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4 FY2026)
Present dashboards to Audit Committee and Board
Coordinate with Internal Audit for 3rd line assurance
Present declaration support pack to board

commonChallenges.challenge: Control owners don't understand P29 requirements
commonChallenges.solution: Run 90-minute interactive workshop using control owner training template; provide user guides and FAQs
Re-apply materiality filter; consolidate related controls; focus on 'Jenga test' (does removal cause business to wobble?)

commonChallenges.challenge: Board disengaged or delegating entirely to Audit Committee
commonChallenges.solution: Schedule full board workshop in Q1 2025; insist on quarterly dashboard review at full board, not just Audit Committee
Escalate to Steering Committee; consider interim manual processes but flag risk of scalability issues

roles.name: Control Owner (1st Line of Defence)
roles.description: Executes controls daily/weekly/monthly, maintains evidence, conducts self-assessments, and reports to 2nd line. Foundation of the control framework.
keyResponsibilities: Execute assigned controls per defined frequency
Participate in control testing by 2nd and 3rd line

whatYouNeedToKnow.detail: Review your assigned controls in the MCI; understand which principal risks they mitigate
Know whether your controls are daily, weekly, monthly, or quarterly
Understand what 'good' looks like (e.g., '100% of invoices approved within 48 hours')
Know what evidence to keep, where to store it, and how long to retain it (typically 7 years)
Know who to contact if a control fails or if you need support

timeline.activity: Training on your assigned controls (workshops, user guides, simulations)
Document your controls using standardised template
Participate in dry run (execute controls, collect evidence, complete self-assessment)
Execute controls per frequency; collect evidence; complete monthly self-assessment

trainingChecklist: Understand what 'material control' means and why your controls are material
Know your control objectives (what the control is designed to prevent/detect)
Understand effectiveness criteria (how to know if your control is working)
Know where to store evidence (GRC platform, shared drive, or other repository)
Understand escalation process (who to contact for issues, when to escalate)

steps: Review control definition (what, how, when, by whom)
Complete self-assessment (pass/fail; if fail, document reason and remediation)

types: Approval logs (e.g., signed purchase orders, invoice approvals)
System reports (e.g., access logs, transaction reports)
evidenceCollection.storage: GRC platform or designated shared repository

whenToEscalate: Unable to execute control (system down, resource unavailable)
Unsure how to interpret control definition
issueEscalation.whoToContact: Your 2nd line contact (CRO/Risk team) or designated escalation point
issueEscalation.howToEscalate: Log issue in GRC platform or email escalation contact with: Control ID, description of issue, impact, proposed remediation

roles.name: Internal Audit / 2nd Line Assurance
roles.description: Provides independent testing of material controls, validates effectiveness assessments, and delivers assurance reporting to Audit Committee and Board.
keyResponsibilities: Independent testing of material controls (3rd line)

testingPlan.phase3: Define testing protocols, sample sizes, and methodologies
testingPlan.phase4: Execute testing quarterly or annually per control

sampleSizes.statistical: Use statistical sampling for high-volume, automated controls

testingProtocolLibrary.method: Review user access logs; test segregation of duties; validate privileged access approvals
testingProtocolLibrary.passCriteria: Zero unauthorised access incidents; 100% of privileged access approved

testingProtocolLibrary.method: Select sample of reconciliations; verify completion, approval, and timely resolution of exceptions
testingProtocolLibrary.passCriteria: 100% completed within defined timeframe; all exceptions resolved

testingProtocolLibrary.method: Review user roles and permissions; identify conflicts; validate mitigating controls

roles.name: Programme Manager / Project Lead
roles.description: Day-to-day project management, maintains timeline, coordinates workstreams, tracks deliverables, manages risks and issues, reports to steering committee.
keyResponsibilities: Maintain project plan and timeline (Gantt chart, milestone tracking)

members: Functional leads (Finance, IT, Ops, Legal, ESG)

stakeholderCommunication.content: Executive summary, RAG status, key milestones, decisions required
Detailed progress, risks/issues, budget, resource needs
Training updates, expectations, Q&A, success stories
What is P29, why it matters, progress, what's expected

criticalSuccessFactors: Secure executive sponsor (CFO/CEO) and maintain their visibility
Define clear governance (steering committee, working groups, escalation)
Build cross-functional team with empowered representatives
Celebrate milestones (board approval, dry run success, go-live)
